image.altText: a woman smiling, being supported by another woman who is her lawyer

props.synopsis: The New South Wales government says it will not disclose the amount Ms Folbigg will be paid after she successfully fought for her freedom after being exonerated of killing her four children.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg's $2m compensation for jailing 'unjust', solicitor says

image.altText: ASX logo and board

props.synopsis: The corporate regulator dropped a bombshell on stock exchange operator, the ASX, which now faces the prospect of increased competition, against the backdrop of an embarrassing mistake.

title.children: The ASX's TPG bungle adds to a decade of woes

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at parliament house.

props.synopsis: This week in Canberra a top cop resigned, Japan was chosen to build Australia's warships and pressure mounted on the Albanese government to recognise the state of Palestine.

title.children: Japan to build Australia's warships, a top cop leaves and pressure mounts on Albanese

image.altText: Gareth Ward in blue shirt and tie and black blazer

props.synopsis: Convicted sex offender MP Gareth Ward has lost his bid for court orders to prevent his expulsion from NSW parliament.

title.children: MP convicted of sex crimes loses bid to stop parliament expulsion

image.altText: A view through a car window at a row of tall hard shelters and white bales.

props.synopsis: The ABC crosses into the Gaza side of the Kerem Shalom border, an opportunity to gain access to a site Israel is using to prosecute its case it is trying to feed the population of Gaza — an argument the humanitarian community, and world leaders, argue is full of holes.

title.children: A few metres inside Gaza sit spoiled food, aid and a controlled media operation

image.altText: One hand putting a wedding band onto the finger of another hand

props.synopsis: Australians are marrying and divorcing less and having fewer children: it’s emblematic of deep and complex social change.

title.children: Divorces have dropped to their lowest rate since no-fault divorce was introduced

image.altText: Plastic waste on Djulpan beach in Arnhem Land

props.synopsis: Final negotiations on a treaty to end plastic pollution are underway in Geneva. But with the United States lining up in opposition to Australia and about 100 other nations, hopes are dimming for the most ambitious proposals to cut plastic production.

title.children: Last-ditch negotiations for a treaty to 'end' plastic pollution have hit a hurdle

image.altText: Reza Zavvar smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has been deporting migrants to places they've never been. Now, immigration agents have told an Iranian man they are planning to send him to Australia.

title.children: Iranian man, arrested in US, told he'll be deported to Australia

image.altText: David Sevelle with his arms up on a video Zoom call.

props.synopsis: As many as 2,000 people lined up to give this man their money — and then they learned his true identity.

title.children: Identity of Australian behind 'ethical' internet horrifies customers

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man with blue eyes, wearing a light-coloured shirt as he walks out of court.

props.synopsis: The jury has heard of secret recordings and Matt Wright pressuring an injured pilot to doctor flight logs in the Netflix star's criminal trial, before the defence took the stand.

title.children: 'Just torch it': Jury hears of secret recording of Netflix star — as it happened

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at podium in White House

props.synopsis: Texas is the site of a massive political showdown that could have a direct influence on US President Donald Trump's ability to continue his agenda. Here's a basic breakdown of what's going on.

title.children: A showdown in Texas could shape the future of Trump's presidency

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister has talked down the prospect of major tax reform emerging from the government's productivity round table, less than a fortnight from the forum at which the treasurer has said that nothing will be off the table.

title.children: Prime minister plays down tax reform opportunity at productivity meeting

image.altText: Two men in suits outside a sandstone building.

props.synopsis: Eric Abetz takes over as treasurer, while Bridget Archer is given the health portfolio, as Jeremy Rockliff reveals his cabinet picks for Tasmania's next government.

title.children: Abetz in, Barnett out as treasurer in Tasmanian Liberals cabinet shuffle

image.altText: Lisa Millar in a yellow raft paddle in hand with a man behind her going down a river with a big smile on her face.

props.synopsis: When Lisa Millar and the Back Roads crew set out to film along the mighty Snowy River, they were quickly reminded that the landscape can be as unpredictable as it is stunning.

title.children: 'We need to get out of here now': Lisa Millar's adventure on the Snowy River

image.altText: A jeweller in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating two complaints about thieves scamming Nepalese jewellers in Canberra.

title.children: Almost $40k in jewellery allegedly stolen in apparent fake receipts scam

image.altText: Nic White gives double thumbs up during Wallabies Test.

props.synopsis: Wallabies scrum-half Nic White is included in the Wallabies' initial Rugby Championship squad, less than a week after playing what appeared to be his farewell Test.

title.children: Wallabies veteran backtracks on retirement to face Springboks

image.altText: Kelia Gallina riding a wave at Teahupo'o

props.synopsis: When Australian Molly Picklum hits the water at the world-famous Teahupo'o, the crowd will be firmly behind a history-making 12-year-old.

title.children: History-making 12yo surfer set to battle Australia's number one in Tahiti

image.altText: Full moon

props.synopsis: It comes just three months after China and Russia announced they were considering a joint effort to also put a nuclear power station on the Moon in a new race for space dominance.

title.children: NASA to fast-track plan to put nuclear reactor on the Moon by 2030

image.altText: Men in white suits, walking into a mine entrance framed by shipping containers.

props.synopsis: Inspectors enter an underground coal mine in central Queensland for the first time since an explosion sent miners fleeing to the surface last year.

title.children: Mine rocked by huge underground blast unseals shafts after 12 months

image.altText: super-young wrap longevity tech

props.synopsis: Cryotherapy, infant stem cells, extreme cold, IV infusions, red light therapy … more Australians are paying big bucks to buy into a "longevity" industry worth an estimated $2.5 trillion globally — and that has some traditional doctors worried.

title.children: The longevity movement is growing, but doctors warn consumers to be cautious

image.altText: Man sitting in a bus wearing a high visibility jacket.

props.synopsis: Disability employment support service Forrest Personnel is shutting down after four decades, saying new contracts offered by the federal government makes the program unviable.

title.children: Vital 40yo disability job service closes doors amid 'non-viable' reform

image.altText: Charlotte Walker smiles as she sits wearing a black blazer

props.synopsis: Charlotte Walker says she has faced both misogyny and criticism in her short time as South Australian senator, but says it's all worth it to be a politician.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator says misogyny, ageist comments 'worth it'

image.altText: A man in a suit, seen from close up, looking down

props.synopsis: The US president is searching for a way to end the bloodshed in Ukraine and his latest plan involves combining two favoured punishments: more sanctions, more tariffs.

title.children: Trump's sanctions–tariffs combo could create a reality some find frightening

image.altText: Max Gawn with his arm around Simon Goodwin

props.synopsis: Melbourne's captain says he is not angry at the sacking of the coach, as he urges prospective candidates to take the call from the Demons.

title.children: Gawn shocked by Goodwin sacking but tells Demons 'don't wait' on replacement

image.altText: Pensive young girl looking at mobile phone on sofa at home.

props.synopsis: With the social media ban for under-16s set to come into effect in December, this is what experts have to say about managing kids and their YouTube use.

title.children: 'Basic' ways to help your kids cut back on YouTube ahead of the ban

image.altText: Man uses his phone to pay at a teller.

props.synopsis: Experts warn the Reserve Bank's proposal to end card surcharges to save consumers money could have unintended consequences.

title.children: What it will really cost consumers if the RBA scraps card surcharges

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

props.synopsis: The federal government is working to shield Australia from Donald Trump's potential tariffs, but the peak pharmaceutical industry body argues there's a bigger issue closer to home.

title.children: Health minister 'concerned' about Trump tariffs but some warn of a bigger issue

image.altText: A large circular CSIRO logo on the side of a building.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO is facing hundreds more cuts to staff, after more than 400 jobs were slashed last year, the union has warned.

title.children: Possibility of hundreds of job cuts 'unsettling' for CSIRO staff

image.altText: A line of women in blue burqas, and one woman wearing a white burqa.

props.synopsis: Afghanistan's rulers have "weaponised" the legal and judicial system to oppress women and girls in what amounts to "crimes against humanity," according to the UN's independent human rights investigator for the country.

title.children: Taliban has 'weaponised' the judicial system to oppress women, UN expert says

image.altText: A digital render of a white suspension bridge extending across deep blue waters

props.synopsis: The Meloni government has cleared the way to build a $24-billion suspension bridge, which would link the mainland with Sicily.

title.children: Italy greenlights world's longest suspension bridge to Sicily

image.altText: Michael Voss wearing a Carlton Blues polo speaking

props.synopsis: After a lengthy board meeting on Wednesday, Carlton coach Michael Voss is backed to coach next season, despite the Blues' horror 2025 campaign.

title.children: Under-fire Voss 'unanimously endorsed' by Blues to coach into 2026 season

image.altText: Rugby player running with the ball in two hands

props.synopsis: Leroy Carter's first All Blacks call-up goes pear-shaped after his dog shreds his passport days before he is due to leave on a tour of Argentina.

title.children: 'Bit of a shambles': All Blacks rookie forced to scramble after dog chews up passport

image.altText: A rainy day in Broken Hill in outback nsw

props.synopsis: Wet weather in July sent rainfall records tumbling in Broken Hill, bringing welcome relief to graziers who had experienced a hot and dry start to the year.

title.children: Outback NSW records wettest July in 20 years after warmest start in decades
